page.title: 03A MIXED FARM NR.CRICKET
page.content: Ludney Farm is divided into two farms each covering 218 acres.They own about 10 acres of woodland and about 2 acres of marshland.They keep about 100 Friesian dairy cattle.They also keep 200 store cattle and 1 Hereford bull.There are about 250 sheep on the farm and they keep 45 of the lambs for the flock.They also keep about 30 hens and ducks and six gleanies. Arable crops are grown on the farm.Wheat covers 14 acres,Barley 56 acres and Oats 5 acres.They make about 5500 bales of straw,5000 bales of hay, and 1400 tons of silage.They also have 9 acres of fodder beet which produces 50 tons per acre;6 acres of swedes;5 acres of turnips and 10 acres of potatoes. They are employing 5 workers at the moment.One is the Dairyman the others are on seasonal work.(continue-page4)
